application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: (T1) Dead Sycamore at entrance: section fell to ground level. Reasons: dead tree danger to public over road and footpath.(T2) Dead Sycamore at entrance: section fell to ground level. Reasons: dead tree danger to public over road and footpath. (T3) Oak: crown reduce by 45%. Reasons: completely hollow trunk approximately 2.8m from ground next to footpath, car park entrance and playing field. (G1) Row of Oak trees overhanging footpath and playing field: remove deadwood. Reasons: safety concerns due to some large dead branches overhanging driveway. (T4) Veteran Oak: remove large amounts of deadwood from crown, retaining secondary crown. Reasons: safety concerns due to large pieces of deadwood in tree, overhanging playing field and driveway. Thomas Wooster has requested the possibility of leaving a large dead log on the floor next to the base of the tree for a seating area. (G2) Group of burnt trees around the barn site: 5 x Ash section fell to ground level, 2 x Oaks remove deadwood, 1 x Hawthorn: section fell to ground level. Reasons: trees have been damaged by barn fire. (G3) Group of 4 x Ash trees: section fell to ground level. Reasons: Inonotus Hispidus bracket fungi killing trees. (G4) Row of trees on boundary to playing fields: remove major deadwood overhanging playing area. Reasons: safety concerns, large dead branches.(G5) 2 x Oak trees: remove major deadwood and sever ivy, 1 x dead tree covered in ivy: shape ivy into dome (tree seems stable), 7 x dead elms: section fell to ground level, 1 x Ash: remove large stem protruding over road. Reason routine maintenance and safety precautions due to this row of trees running parallel with Dulwich Common (A205).(G6) Pile of waste left by the volunteer group: chip and remove waste.
decision_conditions: Time Limit for Works to TPOs
